Jamie

Thanks anyway


Alex

-----Original Message-----
From: Morag Reavley
Sent: Thu 11/02/2010 18:48
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: FW: Broken links
 
Is it possible to pacify this woman from the National Archives by arranging for redirects to the Culture Major Projects pages?

________________________________

From: Soper, Fleur [mailto:Fleur.Soper@nationalarchives.gsi.gov.uk] 
Sent: 11 February 2010 18:46
To: Morag Reavley
Subject: RE: Broken links

 

Hi Morag, Thanks very much; it's the links to your content from other organisations that I am worried about - other people involved in the projects etc. If they don't know that the URL has changed, they won't know to update their links. Does that make sense?

Many thanks again, Fleur

 

From: Morag Reavley [mailto:Morag.Reavley@london2012.com] 
Sent: 11 February 2010 14:03
To: Soper, Fleur; Chris Pollard
Subject: RE: Broken links

 

Hi Fleur

 

Just to be clear though: redirects are a short-term fix. In the long term you should really update the links to the correct ones as I indicated below.

 

Morag

 

________________________________

From: Soper, Fleur [mailto:Fleur.Soper@nationalarchives.gsi.gov.uk] 
Sent: 11 February 2010 11:47
To: Morag Reavley; Chris Pollard
Subject: RE: Broken links

 

Hi Morag, Thank you for your email. It would be extremely useful to provide redirects for all these pages please. When you go to these URLs directly from outside, it looks like the content is missing.

Thanks and best wishes, Fleur

 

From: Morag Reavley [mailto:Morag.Reavley@london2012.com] 
Sent: 11 February 2010 09:42
To: Chris Pollard; Soper, Fleur
Subject: RE: Broken links

 

Hi Fleur

 

Thanks for your email. The links are broken as we relaunched our website in late November last year, and these seem to point to the old website. While we did a pretty good job of redirecting lots of links from the old site to the new, there were some which slipped through the net, and it looks like these were among them.

 

You can find the correct project links on this page: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/major-projects/index.php 

 

Are you able to update your records using the new links - or do you need us to create redirects for all these pages?

 

Kind regards

 

Morag

comments.value:
"As I think I mentioned previously, we are in the position where the ODA have a certain amount of budget unspent for the present financial year, which falls within their contribution to website maintenance.
 
We would therefore like to assign £50k worth of development value to be invoiced directly to the ODA. Ideally this will cover some development work (ongoing, recent, future) which has some specific ODA relevance, but general site maintenance is fine too. I suggest this is something you review with Liz at your next catch up.
 
In order for Alex to have this approved, we would need a formal cost estimate from you setting out the cost and the work it relates to.
 
Is this something you can do fairly imminently? I would like to get this to Alex by Monday if possible.
 
Many thanks,
 
Morag"
Quote sent.

subject: Cost estimate for ODA invoice
description:
"As I think I mentioned previously, we are in the position where the ODA have a certain amount of budget unspent for the present financial year, which falls within their contribution to website maintenance.
 
We would therefore like to assign £50k worth of development value to be invoiced directly to the ODA. comments.value:
Hi Jamie
 
We talked about the need to adapt some templates for our updated International Inspiration section on london2012.com earlier in the week.
 
The launch of this programme is in Vancouver on 17 Feb but they want to have the pages live by 12 Feb if possible.
 
The principal requirement is an adapted version of the subhub template to accommodate video and more promotional areas. I attach a crude mock-up to show you what the changes would be but they are:
We need a video in place of the square hero image. I have asked Big Button to create a player similar to the one created for 1000 days to go; it will be 340x 355 px.
 
Down the right hand column we would like to add in two content feature boxes (text) down the right hand side of the hub page, plus Other sites and Publications feature boxes, and remove the Upcoming events box altogether. Is it also possible to pull in Latest news and Latest blogs into this template?
 
Along the bottom of the page we would like to incorporate a graphic along the width of the page, similar to the pictogram graphics on the Sports content pages. Is it possible to add an editable graphic area along the bottom? I am happy to lose the scrolling feature device as this will interfere with the graphic.
 
I would also need a modified version of the content page which could incorporate a graphic along the bottom, similar to the landing page. The content pages should have Related photos and Videos plus all the usual content boxes except Upcoming events. Is it also possible to embed videos as standard within these pages?
 
On the II pages I would like to just be able to pull in International Inspiration themed news and blogs. I don’t think this tag exists in the system as a main category – can we add it so that we can localise the news and blogs content on the page?
 
In terms of timeline, this is unfortunately short notice but high priority. I am hoping that it is possible to utilise existing modules to make these changes not too onerous. Is it possible to make these amds by the end of Weds, 7 Feb so that we can input the content ready for the launch of the Vancouver Games on Friday night?
 
Many thanks for your help. Do let me know if you have any questions!

Hi Morag - I've created two new templates for you; Inspiration content and Inspiration hub.

They might look a little sparse at the moment, so I'd suggest filling them in and then letting me know if you need anything further added or moved. The promo boxes at the side of the page come with headlines and text/image areas. If you want just image-based promos to appear there the headlines can be left blank.

Also, I removed the tickets promo as per your mockup, but I can very quickly reinstate it.

I've created an International Inspiration tag, so you should be able to use that to mark up content, and I believe that the related news/blogs will start pulling the relevant pages in once there are a few published.

Thank you very much, Marna.

 

Looking at these now and will let you know if I have any queries!

 

________________________________

Hi Marna

 

Could you let me know the dimensions for the video player area - is it
the size of the normal blog video player?

 

Morag 

 

________________________________

Just adding content now and have a few adjustments to request, please!

Inspiration content page - the graphic at the bottom of the page should go all the way across, as it does on the Inspiration hub page. Currently it just covers the middle column.

Inspiration hub page - there are two promos called 'Other sites' - one of these should be called 'Documents' please

Many thanks!
I've fixed those two, Morag. Let me know if there are any other tweaks you need?

________________________________

category (required)
The name you supply for the group of objects you want to track.
action (required)
A string that is uniquely paired with each category, and commonly used to define the type of user interaction for the web object.
label (optional)
An optional string to provide additional dimensions to the event data.


Here's how it's to be implemented:
Homepage promos: Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: '1', '2', '3', '4' or '5'
News/blog: Category: 'newsblog', Action: 'switch', Label 'news', 'blog'
Funders: Category: 'funders', Action: 'carousel', Label 'left', 'right'
Partners: Category: 'partners', Action: 'carousel', Label 'left', 'right'
Webcams/Videos: Categroy: 'webcamsvideos', Action: 'switch', Label: 'webcams', 'videos'
Videos: Category: 'video', Action: 'play', Label: video url (Further events as lightbox goes live)

Sounds v sensible.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com

https://www.google.com/analytics/reporting/event_objects?id=3492254&pdr=20100209-20100209&cmp=average

Let me clarify:
Instead of
Homepage promos: Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: '1', '2', '3', '4' or '5' 

We are tracking

Homepage promos:
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Photos: Olympic Village taking shape'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Go for gold'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Olympic Park parklands project underway'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Photos of the week'

So instead of the not too meaningful 1, 2, 3, 4 labels we're using the title of the promo - when a new promobox is added, its title will be picked up. See here:
https://www.google.com/analytics/reporting/event_object_action_detail?id=3492254&pdr=20100209-20100209&cmp=average&d1=promo&d2=switch&tab=0&view=0&tchcol=0
